intro: Eriodictyon traskiae, commonly known as Trask's yerba santa, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of California. It is characterized by its gray-green, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is part of the soapwort family (Scrophulariaceae) and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. Its leaves contain compounds that have been historically used for their medicinal properties. Eriodictyon traskiae plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of coastal ecosystems.
